byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Tokyo, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Cairo, Michael R. Gordon from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: American Defense Sec Ashton B Carter says Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula is capitalizing on chaos created by Saudi airstrikes in Yemen to seize territory there; statement comes as acknowledgement that counterterrorism effort in Yemen may be complicating problems in region.
lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter acknowledged Wednesday that the Qaeda affiliate in Yemen had exploited the tumult partly created by the Saudi-led airstrikes there to capture territory.

headline.main: Al Qaeda Is Capitalizing on Yemen’s Disorder, U.S. Warns
headline.print_headline: Al Qaeda Is Capitalizing on Yemen’s Disorder, U.S. Warns

snippet: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter acknowledged Wednesday that the Qaeda affiliate in Yemen had exploited the tumult partly created by the Saudi-led airstrikes there to capture territory.
